item.title: 对一些水手来说，出海只是一种手段，是为了从一个巡航区域到达另一个巡航区域，而对另一些水手来说，出海更多的是为了在海上度过的时光--这是一种精神追求，也是一种实际的追求：
item.description:
While for some sailors going offshore is a means to an end, to get from one cruising area to another, for others it’s more about the time spent at sea — a spiritual pursuit as much as a practical one: https://t.co/GCFRRDQnVl

— Financial Times (@FT) February 25, 2024

item.title: 在他以奥斯威辛集中营为背景的影片赢得三项英国电影金像奖的同时，这位导演在与英国《金融时报》的午餐会上谈到了对电影观众的挑战--以及邪恶的平庸：
item.description:
'If [the film] turns people’s stomachs, then it’s doing its work.'

As his Auschwitz-set film wins three Baftas, the director talks about challenging cinema-goers — and the banality of evil, over Lunch with the FT: https://t.co/fFdXwLRuOq

— Financial Times (@FT) February 25, 2024

item.title: 无论你对[政治]的看法如何，它都会进入你的生活，钻进你的房子，让你不得不面对它。 自普京对乌克兰发动战争以来，这位俄罗斯作家一直流亡在外，他谈到了被禁书籍--以及阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼之死。
item.description:
'Regardless of how you feel about [politics], it enters your life, it worms its way into your house, and you’re forced to reckon with it.'

In exile since Putin’s war on Ukraine, the Russian author talks about banned books — and the death of Alexei Navalny https://t.co/h9bZtDLRPS

— Financial Times (@FT) February 25, 2024

item.title: 我想，除了无处不在的化纤泡芙之外，一定还有其他选择，因为一次偶然的机会，我发现自己面对着一件华丽的新款羽绒服。
item.description:
'There had to be an alternative to the ubiquity of the synthetic puffa, I thought, as by pure chance I found myself face to face with a resplendent new duffel coat' https://t.co/UfNVOV8UMW

— Financial Times (@FT) February 25, 2024
